name: Azul Beach Hotel, by Karisma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went in early June with a girlfriend and returned with my husband in late Oct. 2012. We stayed in the new section with just a slice of ocean view in June and stayed in the older, ocean front section in Oct. The room in Villa 9 (new) was exceptional in every way, decor, space ( large living, dinning room, separate bedrm, large bath w/jetted, free standing tub, sep. shower & toilet area) and ammenities. Large veranda with comfy seating. The older rm. in Villa 4 needs renovation and is much smaller but I would chose it again for the glorious ocean view (never garuanteed ahead). The food was very good with lots of choices in cuisine. The beach was excellent, a bit grassy but the staff worked VERY hard to keep the beach clear and the beds under palapas on the waters edge are heaven. The best things about Azul Beach Hotel are the dedicate staff providing outstanding service and the small size, about 100 rms. so you feel pampered every minute. We will return again in Late May of 2013.
reviews.title: Two trips to Azul Bch Hotel this year..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1st Stay, won't be our last. Azul Beach is absolutly the best vacation experience we have enjoyed. From the time Lomas Travel dropped us off and picked us up for our departure, everything was fabulous. Slight misstep on our room the first day, but kudos to Dennys, our perosnal concierge who ensured everything was to our satisfaction. He checked on us every day. The beach was just ok - El Dorado has a nicer beach. We enjoyed the restaurants; Roma, Chil and Tainan: All excellent. No kids with us but it sure looked like the children we having a great time. Great for families or couples. We saw two weddings while we were there. Olga (front desk) was very helpful and genuinely concerned about our stay. Ordered a massage and hydrtherapy (sorry-don't remember the masseuse's name). He was as excellent! I could tell that our enjoyment was geniuinely important to most everyone we met. Overall, excellent resort made better by the excellent, personal service we received. Will definitely return.
reviews.title: Beautiful in January!

reviews.text: This was our 4th stay at this resort..first when our daughter was 15 months right after the hurricane to now with 2 children and she is 8. It keeps getting better every year. We love how clean the rooms, grounds, bathrooms and restaurants are maintained. The staff is beyond wonderful..to name a few stand outs..Benjamin and Revecca the beach butlers..Reuben during breakfast always his smile and service started the day off right. Salvadore, part of the waitstaff. Jesuah and Javier from the entertainment staff. Isreal and Hans..beach butlers outstanding service and attention to details. The food is excellent and fresh, prepared well and presentation most beautiful. We really keep trying to venture out to try something "new and diffferent" but have a hard time going anywhere else because this place is PERFECT!
reviews.title: AWESOME family vacation

reviews.text: I should mention, before I start this review, that we are the members of Karisma resorts, so we probably have gotten some extra services that are not offered to all guests. But we did buy the membership last year based on the excellent service we've got last year at Azul Sensatori, and, this time, it was even better!
reviews.title: Had a fantastic stay. Will return next year!

reviews.text: I'm a dedicated tripadvisor reader and online research freak, so I had a high expectations coming to visit this resort. We've been to the area pretty much every year except for an odd year here and there when we wanted to try the different parts of Carribean. In Riviera Maya, we've stayed at Paradisus Riviera Maya (before they have changed the management and became Now Sapphire), Dreams Riviera Cancun, Grand Palladium White Sands, and Azul Sensatori before. They are all amazing resorts, and you won't be disappointed in any of them, but the reason we chose Karisma resorts was because of their personalized service, feel and child friendliness. Their staffs and concierges are doing amazing job, and I don't remember them being pushy at all when we attended a shortened presentation last year (we had a 5 month old then...told them at the beginning that we can't and won't participate in long presentation). To be honest, I think it won't be a bad idea to purchase their program if you are planning on returning to Karisma resorts year after year and bring family and friends with you. Otherwise, it seems a little complicated to figure out how to exchange our weeks, etc., so I'm not so sure about that part. We are still learning, tho.
reviews.title: Fabulous resort, food and service

reviews.text: We traveled from Feb 2-12, and we are a family of 4, with a 16 month old and a 4 yr old, and Azul is the perfect resort for the little ones. I love the fact that I don't need to pack all the baby gears except diapers and wipes. We were picked up by a nice, roomy and air-conditioned Lomas travel private transfer at the airport, and after 20 mins, we were at the resort. When we got to the hotel around 2 pm, we were greeted by our concierge Melissa, and check in was easy (and, yes, with champagne, cold towels, pillow menu and room spray) since our room was already ready.
reviews.title: Love this resort

reviews.text: This was both my first trip to Mexico and my first stay at an all inclusive resort. My level of trepidation was high as I was hosting my entire family, eight adults and five children under 7 years of age. This was likely to be a once in a lifetime experience, and it could not have been better.... it was wonderful. Transportation to and from the resort was seamless and on arrival everyone was in awe at the setting and the champagne welcome. We had booked the family suites with their patio access to the pools which were a real hit with both the kids and the adults. The room themselves were large and very well appointed.The multitude of restaurants made enjoying a different dining experience ever evening a breeze. And oh, the waiters. They made dining with children a joy. The selection and quality of the meals was excellent.The Spa and fitness facilities were first class as was the variety of recreational activities, both scheduled and unscheduled. The nightly entertainment just added to the overall experience. The kids programs and baby-sitting services were wonderful. The kids loved them and the parents appreciated the break from hands on family duties.
reviews.title: WOW....WOW!!!!!!

reviews.text: The Azul Beach Hotel markets itself as a family friendly resort. I don't know how it could be more so! Collectively my family members have vacationed in Mexico more than 10 times as individuals, couples and families with kids; to a person they said this was the best overall resort they had stayed at.
reviews.title: Went For a Wedding...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first arrived, we felt like royalty, because everyone was so eager to help us....BUT...a couple of days into our trip, we went to dinner at one of the inclusive restaurants on-site. I ordered "a glass of white wine." The waiter said, "Of course, of course, here is our wine menu, just pick what kind of wine you want!" My husband and I thought, "Wow! We can pick our own GLASS??" So I chose a white wine that sounded good.
reviews.title: Impressive

reviews.text: The waiter brought out a bottle and opened it and poured me a glass -- which surprised us since I just ordered a glass! -- to make a long story short, the waiter had me sign a slip before we left, which we thought was unusual, but this was our first experience in a restaurant, so I signed it. The next day, my husband asked our fellow guests (who were our relatives) if they had to sign anything after dinner the night before, and no one had. When we did further inquiring, we found out that we'd been charged $104 for the wine!! I only had ONE GLASS! We called the restaurant, we spoke to the hotel manager, we spoke to about 6 different people -- all of whom said, "No worries! We will figure this out!" -- in the end, they charged us $104 for the glass of wine. ONE GLASS. They all said I should've known I'd be charged, but how were we to know???
reviews.title: Wedding in Paradise

reviews.text: The other guests said they'd ordered certain items, but were told, upon ordering, that the items were not included in the "all-inclusive" items, giving them an opportunity to change their minds, which they did. I wasn't told a thing about the wine not being included under the "all-inclusive" umbrella; otherwise, I'd've ordered something else.
reviews.title: Fantastic and would return in a heartbeat!

reviews.text: Just got back from a 4 night trip. Beach is beautiful. Staff was amazing. Food and drinks were great. The child center is great for kids who are at least 4 but they have babysitters for kids under 4. I must say that everything about our trip was great. I will come back again and I think if you have young kids this place is really amazing.
reviews.title: Great Place To Go With Young Kids

reviews.title: Location, Service, and Intimate
Wedding vacation in paradise
reviews.text: We spent some time at the Azul Beach in February. I am a travel agent and did thorough site inspection of the beautiful Azul Beach. The property is stunning, with this gorgeous view of the ocean as soon as you enter the resort. It is a boutique style, family friendly property with great restaurants, beautiful rooms, pools and lovely beach. The property is only 20 min. from the airport, so you will be at your resort in no time, to enjoy this wonderful property.

They have a great program for kids, where they lend baby equipment so you don't have to bring it from home. They have a partnership with Fisher Price, which means they have a wide variety of toys to select from, and your children can select the toys from the menu & keep them with them the entire time, while staying at the Azul. They can even trade them in for different toys, too!
reviews.title: Best vacation

reviews.text: I just returned from a weeks stay at Azul Beach and it exceeded all of my expectations! I was at the resort for a wedding and the staff, particularly Hans, could not have been more helpful. From the shuttle awaiting our arrival at the airport to the bartender recalling our names and favorite drinks, this resort helped to make our stay personal and very memorable. When we were forced to stay two extra days due to Winter Storm Nemo, Beach Bum Vacation and Carey helped to arrange our stay for the extra time at a discounted rate which was very much appreciated. Overall a great experience, one I hope to recreate in the future via Beach Bum Vacation.
reviews.title: Best Resort I've Ever Been To

reviews.text: I recently attended my best friend's wedding at the Azul Beach Resort in Puerto Morelos and I can honestly say that the most disappointing part of the trip was leaving this beautiful place.
reviews.title: Amazing Place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our wedding at Azul Beach on January 12, 2013. Although we were somewhat worried that it would be difficult for the hotel to accommodate a wedding party of our size (we had approximately 100 adults), one of the main reasons we picked Azul Beach is because of its relatively small size and intimacy. Selfishly, we didnt want a wedding at a larger resort with multiple weddings taking place and causing us to feel like we were part of a destination wedding factory. Azul Beach fit the bill perfectly with its personal touch and amazing decor and ambience. Throughout the weekend we were surrounded by everyone we cared about in a close-knit and picturesque environment with fantastic food and amazing scenery.
reviews.title: Azul Beach Wedding Weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we picked Azul Beach because of its size and beauty, the people truly transformed the event from a special weekend to a unique weekend. We initially arranged everything with Jennifer at VIP Vacations. She really went to bat for us to organize how many rooms we could set aside for the wedding party and made sure that we received the best possible negotiated rate for those rooms. Twice she was able to re-negotiate with Azul Beach when the hotel released new group rates and special discounts that we wanted to make sure our guests could advantage of. The other employees at VIP Travel, Ryan and Lauren were also invaluable in coordinating the stays of our guests and making sure that everyone received the accommodations that they wanted.
reviews.title: So near to being very good

reviews.text: In addition to VIP Travel, we cant say enough about the Azul Beach staff that we worked with to make our dream wedding a reality. Erika Torres of Azul Beach was the primary hotel wedding planner we worked with prior to the wedding to order all the amenities and decorations necessary to pull off a wedding. She always made sure to respond to us in a prompt and timely manner and truly tried to make sure that we had the best of everything (when we were shopping around for resorts, we tried working with employees of other hotels on the Mexican Riviera and she was a breath of fresh air by comparison). By the time we got there, our on-site wedding coordinator, Miroslava was a miracle worker. Considering that we had wedding ceremonies that extended over two days and started in the morning and lasted until 11 or 12 at night, she was always available, cheerful, and made sure to take care of every last request. Daphne of Lomas Travel, who we used to provide wedding decorations, also was a tremendous help. Because of the threat of rain, we had to reorganize some events on the fly, and both Miroslava and Daphne made it as stress-free as possible. I wont pretend that there wasnt any stress since it was our wedding weekend after all, but they helped take stress away rather than adding stress, which made all the difference in the world. Finally, all the staff and servers at Azul Beach turned the weekend into one that made us feel at home. By the time we left, staff such as Alberto at Blu, Javier with the activities, Barbara, Lenin, and Alfonso at the front desk, and Irma at the Spa all knew both myself and my wife and made sure that we were not having any problems. It has been a month and a half since our wedding and we still talk about how friendly everyone was and how they made us feel so special throughout our stay there. This was truly the event of our lifetime and we could not have imagined a more perfect weekend.
reviews.title: Wedding Vacation

reviews.text: Booked the holiday with Thomson, upgraded to oceanfront suite with Jacuzzi, I will be taking up problems and discrepancies in their brochure with them.
reviews.title: 3 Weeks in Paradise

reviews.text: The setting and ambiance are excellent with the emphasis on chill areas, swing beds scattered around the hotel lobby and Aquanox bar, the restaurants 5 in total serve food of a very high standard. The entertainment was good and varied.
reviews.title: Excellent family vacation

aka: Azul Beach Hotel, By Karisma Hotel
description: Azul Beach Hotel is a family-friendly, boutique-style property located on a gorgeous beach 20 minutes from Cancun International Airport. All of the newly renovated 148 rooms are just steps from the beach, pools, restaurants and bars.Featuring the Gourmet Inclusive® concept, epicurean offerings include candlelight dining on the beach, a fresh fish fry and butler service to the canopied beach beds. There’s an all-lobster menu, 24-hour room service and over 30 tequilas in the tequila lounge.Azul Beach especially caters to families with young children with loaner baby equipment, kid's club and parent support. The exclusive Family & Friends Vacation Planner coordinates family reunions. Romantic couples love Beachfront Sky Massages and Suite Scenes.
